data.event: Winters are characterized with mild to warm temperatures during the day and cool nights and are dry.
In an average winter, Las Lomitas receives 8.5 days of frost per year while the first and last dates of frost are 28 June and 29 July respectively.
Spring and fall are transition seasons and are rather short featuring hot daytime temperatures and mild nighttime temperatures.

data.event: On average, Las Lomitas receives 862.5 millimetres (34 in) of precipitation per year with 86 days with measureable precipitation with summer months being more wetter than the winter months, where most of the precipitation falls in the form of thunderstorms.
